newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran adds two extra hours for voting.
newsitem.headline: Iran adds two extra hours for voting.

text.p: Iran's election authorities extended the hours of voting on Friday in polls to replace President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani.

Some 33,180 polling stations which opened at 8 a.m. (0330 GMT) had been due to close at 6 p.m. (1330 GMT) but the Interior Ministry, which is in charge of the election, said another two hours would be allowed.
The head of election headquarters at the ministry said that even after the new time of 8 p.m. (1530 GMT) polling stations would not be allowed to close until they received instructions to do so.
Thirty-three million Iranians aged 15 and over were eligible to choose a successor to Rafsanjani, who must step down in August after the maximum two consecutive four-year terms allowed by law.

Iranian analysts predicted a close contest between the two leading candidates, moderate Mohammad Khatami and conservative Ali Akbar Nateq-Nouri. Both are Shi'ite Moslem clerics. Two other candidates are rated outsiders.
